parameters.definition: Amount of gold required for one long cable
Amount of gold required for one short cable
Minimum ratio of short cables to long cables
Minimum number of long cables to be made

description: There is \param{TotalGold} mg of gold available that is needed to make long and short cables. Long cables require \param{GoldLong} mg of gold while short cables require \param{GoldShort} mg of gold. Because of their compact size, at least \param{RatioShortLong} times the number of short cables are needed than the long cables. In addition, there needs to be at least \param{MinLong} long cables made. If each long cable sold results in a \param{ProfitLong} profit and each short cable sold results in a \param{ProfitShort} profit, how many of each type of cable should be made to maximize profit?
